column4: I am not really sure how the ubuntu releases work.  is edgy stuck with 2.6.17 forever now?
so then on april 19th then I will stop getting updates when new versions of the programs I use come out?  (im using feisty)
: How can you you use feisty when it is yet to be released?
I manually changed my sources.list, but as I understand it there is a more graphical nice way to do it now
: Darn .. everything is getting graphical. ;D
: Us ole boyz have a little trouble keeping up with all that fancy graphical stuff.  (At least some of us (me) does).
you can install it, but you have to tweak some of the settings
: Hmm .. I haven't got compiz working.
for some reason ubuntu still influenced by some of the dirty old men that ran debian, and some of the code you need is less kosher, so they don't enable it by default
: But we moved away from debian, just to escape those men, didn't we?
: How is Intels (FOSS) gfx doing performance-wise?
smooth.  on my macbook I notice far less choppyness than on my desktop which uses a geforce 4 nvidia card
: GF4 is old.  But it is nice.
: Maybe its my cpu
: I dont have trouble wit video ... just dvds
: And my trouble with dvds is not actual stops .. but more like a slowdown feeling.
: Only occationally.
: You might want to read this: http://www.gnu.org/licenses/why-not-lgpl.html
: Not exactly the document I was searching for .. but it has some good insights still, IMHO.
im actually pretty well read on the material :-p
: And I posted on the wrong window :)
